titlestmt.titleproper: Finding aid for the Jock Netzorg interviewed by Michael P. Onorato, [sound recording].

profiledesc.creation: Encoded finding aid created from MARC record by Dallas Pillen
profiledesc.langusage: The finding aid is written in English

did.unittitle: Jock Netzorg interviewed by Michael P. Onorato, [sound recording].

descgrp.accessrestrict: The collection is open for research use.
descgrp.userestrict: Copyright in the recording has been assigned to the Regents of the University of Michigan. Copyright in the transcription of the interview is owned by Pacific Rim Books.
descgrp.originalsloc: Sound casettes located with Jock Netzorg audio interviews in the Netzorg family papers sound recordings series (Collection: 2012143 Aa 2, Box 36).

archdesc.bioghist: Morton J. (Jock) Netzorg was a bibliographer of the Philippines and owner, with his wife Petra Fuld Netzorg, of the Cellar Book Shop in Detroit, Mich. Michael P. Onorato was an oral historian and faculty member at California State University-Fullerton.
archdesc.scopecontent: Interview transcribed and published in the book Jock Netzorg: Manila Memories (Laguna Beach, Calif. : Pacific Rim Books, 1988).
